marketNews.title: VAT 12% Only Applies to Luxury Goods
marketNews.content: The Chairman of Commission XI of the DPR, Mukhamad Misbakhun, on Thursday (5/12) stated that the government will still raise the value-added tax (VAT) from 11% to 12% starting January 2025, although he claimed that the increase will only apply to luxury goods. Until now, the government has not released a list of luxury goods that will incur this VAT increase. According to the Deputy Chairman of the DPR, Sufmi Dasco Ahmad, the list of luxury goods subject to 12% VAT will be compiled by the Ministry of Finance. Misbakhun mentioned that staple goods, education services, health services, banking services, and public services will remain exempt from VAT, in line with existing policy. This government announcement comes amid pressure from business groups and labor unions who are requesting a postponement of the VAT increase, considering the weakening purchasing power of the community. According to a Kompas report, the burden carried by the public in 2025 will increase along with the restriction of fuel subsidies, and the implementation of various levies such as the increase in BPJS Kesehatan premium contribution rates, additional mandatory pension fund contributions, and mandatory third-party liability motor vehicle insurance contributions. In a separate occasion, the Minister of SMEs, Maman Abdurrahman, stated on Thursday (5/12) that the government is studying the extension of the 0.5% final income tax (PPh) utilization period for MSMEs. Maman also denied news that the 0.5% final PPh for MSMEs would end in December 2024. Maman affirmed that the applicable provisions remain the same, namely 7 years for individual taxpayers and 4 years for corporate taxpayers.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The selective VAT increase on luxury goods is the government's compromise to increase state revenue while maintaining public purchasing power, especially for the lower-middle class. This generally provides relief to sectors/issuers targeting the lower-middle segment, while potentially having a negative impact on issuers targeting the upper-middle segment. However, the definition and list of 'luxury goods' released by the government need further monitoring to conclude the potential impact on specific sectors/issuers.

marketNews.title: EMTK Buys 87 Million SCMA Shares
marketNews.content: OPEC+ on Thursday (5/12) officially postponed the recovery of oil production for 3 months until April 2025 and extended the oil production recovery period from 12 months to 18 months. Consequently, the 2.2 million barrels per day of oil production from OPEC+ will only fully recover in September 2026, with the recovery speed slowing down monthly from 180,000 barrels per day to 120,000 barrels per day. This decision marks the third postponement of oil production recovery by OPEC+ amid weak demand and a surge in production outside the group. Before being postponed multiple times, OPEC+ initially planned to gradually recover 2.2 million barrels per day of oil production starting from October 2024. Minister of Industry, Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita, claimed that Apple Inc. (Nasdaq: AAPL) will build a factory in Indonesia, although he did not elaborate. Agus mentioned that his ministry has coordinated with the Ministry of Investment to follow up on Apple's investment plan. Previously, the Minister of Investment, Rosan Roeslani, stated this week that Apple had raised its investment proposal to 1 billion US dollars, a 100-fold increase from the initial plan of 10 million US dollars. This investment is aimed at enabling the iPhone 16 series to obtain a 40% domestic component level certificate (TKDN), so it can be officially sold in Indonesia. Bank Indonesia recorded that Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves at the end of November 2024 slightly decreased to 150.2 billion US dollars (vs. October 2024: 151.2 billion US dollars). The position of foreign exchange reserves is equivalent to financing 6.5 months of imports or 6.3 months of imports and government foreign debt payments, which is above the international adequacy standard of around 3 months of imports. Bank Indonesia assesses that these foreign exchange reserves are capable of supporting external sector resilience and maintaining macroeconomy and financial system stability. The Chairman of the Indonesian General Insurance Association, Budi Herawan, stated that the government will implement third-party liability (TPL) insurance in 2H25, according to the initial plan. Nevertheless, Budi could not confirm whether TPL insurance can truly be implemented in 2025, considering it could burden the public. Budi also mentioned that the draft regulation for TPL insurance is already with the Ministry of Finance, although he did not elaborate further on the contents of the regulation. Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Erick Thohir, stated that the government is preparing a 5-year roadmap policy for lowering air ticket prices, aimed at making air ticket prices more affordable for the public. Previously, the government had lowered domestic air ticket prices by 10% during the Christmas and New Year (Nataru) period from December 19, 2024, to January 3, 2025. The Head of Traffic Corps of the Indonesian National Police, Inspector General Pol. Aan Suhanan, said that the total community movement during the Christmas 2024 and New Year 2025 (Nataru) moments is projected to increase by +2.8% YoY to 110.67 million people, based on a survey from the Ministry of Transportation.

tickerNews.title: Elang Mahkota Teknologi (EMTK) Acquires 87 Million Shares of Surya Citra Media (SCMA)
tickerNews.content: Surya Citra Media controller, Elang Mahkota Teknologi ($EMTK), purchased 87 million shares of SCMA at a price of 137 rupiah per share on December 4-5, 2024. The total transaction value reached 11.9 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, EMTK's ownership in SCMA increased from 60.97% to 61.09%.

tickerNews.title: PT Karya Pacific Investama Purchased 6.3 Billion Shares of MNC Energy Investments (IATA)
tickerNews.content: PT Karya Pacific Investama purchased 6.3 billion shares of MNC Energy Investments ($IATA) at a price of 53 rupiah per share on November 25, 2024. The total transaction value reached 333 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, PT Karya Pacific Investama's ownership in IATA increased from 0% to 24.91%.

tickerNews.title: Pyridam Farma (PYFA) Announces Additional Guarantee for Facility from Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited
tickerNews.content: Pyridam Farma ($PYFA) through its subsidiary, Pyfa Australia Pty. Ltd., announced the provision of additional guarantees for a facility amounting to 155 million Australian dollars from Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited. The additional guarantee covers: 1) approximately 83.8 million ordinary shares held by Pyfa Australia in Probiotec, including the rights and benefits attached to those shares, both existing and future; 2) other tradable securities in Probiotec held by Pyfa Australia in the future or other securities agreed upon from time to time; and 3) Pyfa Australia's assets, both existing and future. Pyfa Australia's loan from Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited was previously used by the company to acquire Probiotec.

tickerNews.title: Gunawan Dianjaya Steel (GDST) to Distribute Interim Dividend for 2024 Fiscal Year
tickerNews.content: Gunawan Dianjaya Steel ($GDST) will distribute a 2024 fiscal year interim dividend amounting to 67.2 billion rupiah or 7.5 rupiah per share. The cum date in the regular and negotiated market is December 13, 2024, with payment on December 30, 2024. Referring to the GDST stock price at the market close on Friday (6/12) at the level of 108 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 6.9%.

tickerNews.title: Solusi Sinergi Digital (WIFI) Appoints Shannedy Ong as Director
tickerNews.content: Solusi Sinergi Digital ($WIFI) announced the appointment of Shannedy Ong as a company director with an effective date as of today, Friday (6/12). Previously, Shannedy Ong served as Country Managing Director of Qualcomm Indonesia. The appointment of Shannedy Ong was approved at the EGM (RUPSLB) on Thursday (5/12).

tickerNews.title: Panorama Sentrawisata (PANR) Commissioner Dharmayanto Tirtawisata Increases Shareholding
tickerNews.content: Panorama Sentrawisata's Commissioner, Dharmayanto Tirtawisata, purchased 20 million PANR shares at a price of 550 rupiah per share on December 4, 2024. The total transaction value reached 11 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Dharmayanto Tirtawisata's ownership in PANR increased from 4.99% to 6.43%.

tickerNews.title: Champ Resto Indonesia (ENAK) Signs Additional Loan Facility from Bank Central Asia (BBCA)
tickerNews.content: Champ Resto Indonesia ($ENAK) signed an additional loan facility of 199 billion rupiah from Bank Central Asia ($BBCA), with the purpose of using the funds to support the company's business expansion activities.

tickerNews.title: Indonesian Tobacco (ITIC) Director Djonny Saksono Increases Shareholding
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Indonesian Tobacco ($ITIC), Djonny Saksono, purchased approximately 4.5 million ITIC shares at an average price of ~261 rupiah per share on December 2-4, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 1.2 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Djonny Saksono's ownership in ITIC increased from 67.19% to 67.67%.
